text: LCLS: Deliver 9.8 keV to XPP/MFX, then XLEAP to TMO at 4.5 GeV FACET: 11-2 swap and potential recovery

title: Day shift HRS Log
text: "Opened MV88220 to pressure building circuit on tank 2 and closed MV88115 tank 1 supply. "When I was arriving this morning I noticed that the external purifier bed "B" Ln2 liquid level controller was displaying error code "E006". The system was not filling. I cycled the power & the controller resumed operations. We should probably purchase more units. "The temperature sensors on upper cold box are reading 0 K. It looks like there may the something wrong with cryocons. "I have been looking for the spare heater for the 2k cold box d/p. They were in trailer 26 in a box?????????. If anyone sees these units let me know. They are in silver static bags & they have 2K cold box diffusion pump heater written on them with permanent marker. Found the spare heater: RE 16:30 "Fire watch for new check valve welding "I was asked by Dirk to disconnect the temperature devices connectors on the upper cold box & add shorting foam on CP1 because of the welding on the check valve piping & it's associated vacuum jacket piping. I was also asked by Swapnil to do the same for the lower cold box. "Completed weld inspection on 2 welds for the repair of C1CKV21001. Inspection report can be found here: https://slac.sharepoint.com/sites/lcls/lcls-2/cryogenic/cryop/Forms/AllItems.aspx?id=%2Fsites%2Flcls%2Flcls%2D2%2Fcryogenic%2Fcryop%2FA%2D%20PROJECT%20DOCUMENTATION%2F14%2DIR%2FHRS%2E4K%2ECB%2DIR%2DSLAC%2DC1CKV21001%20Repair%20Weld%20Inspection&viewid=0496b45c%2D3339%2D467c%2D8420%2D86ed9216777c "Ran oil pump on compressor 3.....passed with no leak on new viton o ring. "Ran oil pump on compressor 2.....passed with no leak on new viton o ring. "Installed new viton o ring on oil pump on compressor4 ....leak checked...good...need to run oil pressure to verify viton o ring doesn't leak. "Worked with the riggers to remove HP PRV and install MPH PRV. "I performed the daily walk through I found no issues.

title: TBR 11-2 Klystron has low perveance and RF instabilities. CATER Id: 155359(TEC)
text: Run-up complete. Still has Jitter. Check cables, the Drive cable at klystron end was the only connector loose. Joe O. said it had a bad bend a connector. Should be replaced. Also I had to raise the HVPS V up to 24.34kV to get the BV up to 350kV. The DeQuing stayed pretty stable. But after about 45minutes it started tripping on HVOVs. Turned down to 335kV. But the jitter is better with BV at 350kV. Adjusted the thy res +/- 0.15 but could not find a sweet spot. Past to swing.

title: 11-5 MOD faulted for the third time. CATER Id: 155381
Q0FF and Q5FF are working, for now. Details inside, but more investigation to be planned for next PAMM.
text: Problem with the feed AC power to power supply, 3ph 208. Sagging on 2/3 phases? Low on voltage when loaded. PS would come on, but couldn't get power out. Plug on cord out of breaker into back of rack and power supply was overtightened, S. Jenks thought maybe something wrong with wires crimped into plug. Cut it off, redid connector etc. Didn't fix problem. Tried swapping Q0 and Q5, but for some reason both work. Leaving both on for now. B. Lam will make CATER to investigate power supply next PAMM. Right now Q0's breaker is feeding Q5 and vice versa - just AC power though, controls are still the same (controls don't care where the power comes from, like swapping plugs on two desktop PCs).

title: CATER 155364, FACET Quad Magnet Q5FF: supply has no turn on.
text: This problem occurred late dayshift and was passed on to me. Pete E. already retrieved a spare EMI 20 volt, 125 amp supply and tested it in the shop. Spare works with local control board: produces volts + amps in shop. Swapped supply in rack FKG20-40, level 16. Same indications on local control board: power supply fault, no system ready. Resets + power cycles don't work. Retrieved another spare EMI supply from sector 29: same problem. Swapped bitbus controller: no effect on problem. Noticed bitbus repeater chassis has a 5 volt out of tols light on. Retrieved bitbus repeater from building 725 spares. 5 volt light now out on new repeater, but did not fix Q5FF. Used local control board on Q0 + Q2FF--both supplies produce DC power with local controller. Swapped transductor cables on bitbus controller: no good. Swapped DB 25 comms cable between Q0FF + Q5FF bitbus controllers and supplies. No good. Consulted B Lam and J. Tagle: swapped tested spare back into rack. Measured 208 VAC 3 phase at cord plug: appears 2 phases have about 35 volts between them. Checked feed AC breaker in panel at top of rack: breaker works fine. Shuts off correctly and measures 208 between the phases and 120 to ground. Cut off 2" of cord and AC plug for Q5FF and reterminated it using ferrules on stripped wires. Hoped this would fix problem: no good. Everytime I swapped Q0FF down to Q5FF, Q5 came up and ran locally. Finally swapped AC cords between the 2 supplies: both supplies work with local board and trim remotely. Have no idea why!! This is bizarre. If I swap cords back, likely Q5FF won't work again. Informed EIC and ACR we would leave them like this--if both magnets work, will not disturb ops by attempting to swap back AC cords. Will make temporary signage on feed ac breakers to indicate which breaker goes to which supply for safety purposes. B. Lam is making a CATER for PAMM investigation of feed 208 VAC, 3 phase power. Something strange is happenin' here. I will update DEPOT tomorrow with all the details of the various swaps.

title: Kly Mod 11-2: run up after klystron swap.
text: Received message from D. Steele that 11-2 has run up problems with klystron overvolts and amps. Allan J. said he had to adjust HV set to 24.2 KV to get 350 KV BV. Noticed the Dqing current was high at 26 amps and the DQ volts was well under the HV set X 2. Lowered HV set to 23.2 KV and lowered DQ current to 14.5 amps. Got a trip on klystron overvolts. Lowered HV set to 23 KV and raised DQ I to 15 amps. Mod now sitting at 348 KV BV. Ranged thyratron from 5.1 to 5.4 volts to get rid of the phase jitter. D. Steele reports all good now with the modulator.

title: Longitudinal feedback ran away. Restore Acts cannot bring it back. Ran the fix 6x6, then lowering the rate and let the feedback converges.
Beam restored to TMO
Beam restored to TMO
text: The original problem was that a station tripped off and the feedback ran away. The problem was that during recovery the SXR BC1 IPK control got disabled and the HXR setpoint was different from the SXR setpoint (HXR number was 230, SXR number was 210). With a shorter bunch coming out of BC1 the feedback had to change the settings in L2 and that was enough to mess up the XLEAP config. In the future we could avoid this by ensuring that the HXR and SXR values match, even when we're doing SXR-only delivery. Or we could just not use the SXR controls when we're not doing dual delivery (they're not really needed under those circumstances).

title: Beam restored to TMO

With a shorter bunch coming out of BC1 the feedback had to change the settings in L2 and that was enough to mess up the XLEAP config. In the future we could avoid this by ensuring that the HXR and SXR values match, even when we're doing SXR-only delivery. title: Beam restored to TMO
text: The original problem was that a station tripped off and the feedback ran away. The subsequent problem was that during recovery the SXR BC1 IPK control got disabled and the HXR setpoint was different from the SXR setpoint (HXR number was 230, SXR number was 210). With a shorter bunch coming out of BC1 the feedback had to change the settings in L2 and that was enough to mess up the XLEAP config. In the future we could avoid this by ensuring that the HXR and SXR values match, even when we're doing SXR-only delivery. Or we could just not use the SXR controls when we're not doing dual delivery (they're not really needed under those circumstances). None of this will be relevant any more when we decouple the HXR and SXR longitudinal feedback.
